image.altText: Kira Korolev stands outside the war memorial in Canberra

props.synopsis: Australia's spy agency ASIO was the first authority to investigate concerns about Russian-born Australian citizen Kira Korolev. What followed was close monitoring of the army private and her husband, which has now landed them in custody, facing allegations of spying for their mother country.

title.children: ASIO 'monitored Brisbane couple for period of time' before the were charged over Russian espionage

image.altText: A woman in a red shirt and sunglasses smiles in front of the sea.

props.synopsis: Australian citizen Kira Korolev, an alleged Russian spy, was working as an assistant theatre director in Perth in 2010.Â

title.children: Alleged Russian spy worked as assistant theatre director in Perth

image.altText: A gaunt man in brown prison garb stares straight ahead at the camera

props.synopsis: Hamza Elbaf has been shut off from the outside world for the past five years. The Australian citizen doesn't even know who the prime minister is. He's one of thousands of suspected ISIS fighters being held in Syrian prisons.

title.children: What was this rugby league fan from the suburbs doing with ISIS?

image.altText: Alec Baldwin in a blue suit in front of a cream wall.

props.synopsis: A New Mexico judge has dismissed involuntary manslaughter charges against actor Alec Baldwin over the shooting of Rust cinematographer Halyna Hutchins in 2021.

title.children: Judge dismisses charges against Alec Baldwin over Rust killing

image.altText: A soldier motions to the camera to move away as a huge truck drives into frame onto a pier off a huge boat

props.synopsis: While it was never touted as a complete solution to the problems of getting humanitarian aid into Gaza, the US has announced its temporary aid pier will be shut down after being plagued with challenges.

title.children: How the US-built pier to get aid into Gaza was supposed to work â and why it didn't

image.altText: aerial rooftops in inner suburbs

props.synopsis: Australia's property obsession has made us among the richest in the world, but it's also saddled households with enormous debts, and made monetary policy decisions even harder.

title.children: My way or the narrow pathway: Michele Bullockâs property dilemma

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiling as an excited voter, a young woman, takes a selfie with him.

props.synopsis: After all the bleak headlines of the past couple of weeks, Albanese's cheery optimism may seem a little weird. But some in the government can't believe they're not "cooked".

title.children: After weeks of bleak headlines, some in the Albanese government can't believe they're not 'cooked'

image.altText: drak grey skies over a field with wind farms in taralga north of goulburn new south wales

props.synopsis:
A rapidly deepening low-pressure system in the Tasman Sea will track towards the coast this weekend, the precursor to a bout of severe winter weather across eastern Australia.

Â 

Â

title.children: Intense winter storm to bring heavy rain, gales, bitter cold and snow to eastern Australia

image.altText: CCTV vision of a hooded figure walking down a hotel corridor.

props.synopsis: Police and officials in the Philippines are trying to reassure locals and tourists the area remains safe after a triple murder.Â

title.children: Inside the luxury Philippine hotel where two Australians were found dead

image.altText: A brush turkey standing on a manicured lawn in front of the Sydney Harbour Bridge

props.synopsis: Researchers have charted the historical crash, comeback and conquest of cities by the Australian brush turkey.

title.children: 'A fantastic success story': How brush turkeys are taking over our cities

image.altText: Joe Biden speaks into a microphone and holds the hand of a woman seated at a restaurant table.

props.synopsis: A day after a prime-time press conference that gifted his opponents two highly shareable gaffes, Joe Biden travels to Michigan and makes light of complaints about his age.

title.children: 'I promise you I'm OK': Biden addresses age concerns on campaign trail in Michigan

image.altText: Virginia Trioli smiles while posing for a picture on a white background

props.synopsis: As Maggie Beer brings out a new television program with a focus on elderly citizens, while we witness the US President Joe Biden once again stumble â the complexities of ageing once again comes to the surface.Â

title.children: My niece was elbowed out of the way at a cafe. It got me thinking

image.altText: Labour party leader Jeremy Corbyn holds his hands out by his side in a gesture while speaking in front of a red backdrop.

props.synopsis: During its time in office, the UK Conservative Party was chaotic, inept and hubristic. But, if it was bad, the Labour Party's infighting might have been even worse.

title.children: It took 14 years, but British Labour was finally elected. What took it so long?

image.altText: Large bottles of yellow cooking oil being filled at a factory.

props.synopsis: Australia has been importing cooking oils from one of the companies implicated in a food safety scandal in China, the Department of Agriculture has confirmed.

title.children: China is facing a contaminated cooking oil crisis. Is Australia at risk?

image.altText: Four large winged aircraft sit on the back of trucks that are driving down a road while on parade

props.synopsis: Officials say the technology will allow them to shoot down unmanned aerial vehicles from the North but not all experts are convinced.

title.children: Dubbed the 'Star Wars Project', South Korea plans to use drone-melting lasers against North Korea

image.altText: Black and white photo of school boy smiling. Colour photo of man with grey hair in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: After a humble upbringing marred by racial prejudice and social disadvantage, Ken Wyatt broke new ground for First Nations Australians wanting to have a say in federal decision-making. This is his story.

title.children: From racial prejudice to political triumph, Ken Wyatt's story is of resilience and leadership

image.altText: Composite of Carlos Alcaraz and Novak Djokovic at Wimbledon in 2024.

props.synopsis: Twelve months on from their epic clash on Wimbledon's Centre Court, reigning champion Carlos Alcaraz and seven-time winner Novak Djokovic will meet again in the men's singles decider after their respective triumphs in the semifinals.

title.children: Alcaraz and Djokovic storm into Wimbledon final rematch

image.altText: James Anderson waves to the Lord's crowd as he leaves the field in his final Test for England.

props.synopsis: James Anderson signs off from international cricket with his 704th and final Test wicket, ending a glittering 21-year career during England's emphatic win over West Indies.

title.children: England cricket great Anderson retires with one final flourish

image.altText: Two surfers, one lying on his surfboard and other wave jumping on top of a blue-green wave with a modern building behind them.

props.synopsis: The battle for the surf has moved from the ocean to the pool where rival companies are spending tens of millions of dollars to create the perfect artificial wave.

title.children: Are wave parks the answer to 'surf rage'?

image.altText: A procession of four-wheel drives heading into the bush.

props.synopsis: With more people than ever owning four-wheel drives and taking them off-road to explore the bush, wilderness areas are under unprecedented pressure. So what are the off-road rules?

title.children: Off the road again, but are Australia's 4WD enthusiasts wrecking the bush?

image.altText: Protesters sit down and chant at the Australian National University pro-Palestine encampment.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University has acknowledged "changing expectations" around its investments.

title.children: ANU to review military investments after pro-Palestine protests

image.altText: Firefighters aiming a huge torrent of water from a hose at a prop jet engine ablaze.

props.synopsis: Since the pandemic, aviation services all over Australia have seen a reduction in resources "across the board", which has sparked safety concerns.Â

title.children: 'Smoke and mirrors': Pilots raise concern over resourcing problem at Australian airports

image.altText: A bowl of rice pudding with a sprinkling of brown sugar on a sunny table, the recipe is made on the stove.

props.synopsis: Rice pudding is an easy dessert made with simple ingredients. This version is cooked on the stove and is made custard-like with the addition of eggs.

title.children: An easy rice pudding, made on the stove

image.altText: Jessica Hull with a medal after breaking world 2,000 metres record at Monaco Diamond League meet.

props.synopsis: Just weeks out from Paris, Australian middle distance star Jess Hull posts a world record in the non-Olympic 2,000 metres event at the prestigious Monaco Diamond League meet.

title.children: Aussie Hull smashes world 2,000m record ahead of Paris Olympics campaign

image.altText: Afghan kids

props.synopsis: They call them "The Rascals" of Melrose Park â and these aspiring young football stars have taken their traumatic past and turned it into a wave of positivity.Â

title.children: 'I feel like freedom': The Afghan kids who found purpose and care on Australian soccer pitches

image.altText: Liz Clay grimaces

props.synopsis: After breaking multiple bones in her foot, Olympic hurdler Liz Clay had to take things slowly, even having to learn to walk again. A conversation she had a decade ago gave her the strength to run her way back to the Olympics.

title.children: After a crippling injury, Liz Clay had to learn to walk again, but a decade-old conversation gave her the strength to run

image.altText: A photo of a manga artists' room.

props.synopsis: Here's what artists and producers involved in the creation of Japan's billion-dollar anime industry say about the reality of living and working behind the scenes.

title.children: Behind the screens: Japanese anime creators reveal a billion-dollar industry in crisis

image.altText: An illustration of a man in a white top and red pants sitting in a prison cell looking at a newspaper on a bench

props.synopsis: An anonymous column from a former police officer, an investigation into a death in custody and a visual arts gallery feature in the first edition of a national prison newspaper.Â

title.children: Prison is an information black hole. One newspaper hopes to shine a light inside

image.altText: Bobby Hill, Darcy Moore and Isaac Quaynor walk off

props.synopsis: The AFL's reigning premier Collingwood is in danger of following a premiership by missing the finals after being outmuscled at the MCG by Geelong.

title.children: 'Time is running out': Collingwood's premiership defence on thin ice after loss to Geelong in crucial clash

image.altText: A close-up shot of a young stockman wearing a straw Akubra, staring into the camera lens.

props.synopsis: As another curfew ends in Alice Springs and debate rages over the next steps for the embattled town, a local Indigenous-led program is working hard to lower crime rates in the community.

title.children: Indigenous-led youth program making a difference amid Alice Springs curfew debate

image.altText: Caged hen at Werribee in Victoria

props.synopsis: Farmers and virologists have called for more funding to protect the country's native and commercial birds, with fears the H5 variant could arrive within months.

title.children: Experts warn Australia not investing enough to prepare for 'catastrophic' affects of H5 bird flu variant

image.altText: A woman wearing a red sweater smiles while standing in her front doorway.

props.synopsis: When house-hunting, Bianca Knox quickly fell in love with a 1970s Canberra cottage, but finding ways to keep her home heated in Canberra's harsh climate without breaking the bank was a priority.

title.children: Simple DIY upgrades slashed Bianca's power bill â and experts say building an efficient home doesn't have to break the bank

image.altText: A blond woman points a gun at an unseen threat

props.synopsis: Ti West's X trilogy comes to an end with MaXXXine but he's not going out without some hyperactive, head-burstingly good fun.

title.children: MaXXXine stuffs sex, purity culture and practical effects into a rip-roaring trilogy end
